title: BDR Schema validator
description: Business Driven Detection are non-threat related detection objectives, which are defined as a consequence of compliance, policies or other regulations.

id.title: 🔑 Model Identifier
id.description: Identifier as CDMXXXX where XXXX is incremented from the previous model

criticality.title: 🔥 Criticality
criticality.description: Urgency of the model to be implemented into the next layer, based on the severity rating and after analysis of the current defense capabilities to balance urgency. Socio-economic and leadership requirements are also captured.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
### 🔫 Baseline - Negligible

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0001`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A Baseline–Negligible priority incident is an incident that is highly unlikely to affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence. The potential for impact, however, exists and warrants additional scrutiny.

### 🔫 Baseline - Minor

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0002`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A Baseline–Minor priority incident is an incident that is highly unlikely to affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence. The potential for impact, however, exists and warrants additional scrutiny.

### 🔫 Low

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0003`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A Low priority incident is unlikely to affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.

### ❗ Medium

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0004`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A Medium priority incident may affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.

### ⚠️ High

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0005`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A High priority incident is likely to result in a demonstrable impact to public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.

### 🚨 Severe

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0006`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

A Severe priority incident is likely to result in a significant impact to public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, or civil liberties.

### ☢️ Emergency

🔑 **Identifier** : `CRT0007`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

An Emergency priority incident poses an imminent threat to the provision of wide-scale critical infrastructure services, national government stability, or human lives.

internal.title: 🏦 Private references
internal.description:
Propriatary, sensible and confidential data belonging to the owner of the CoreTIDE instance
where the object was modelled on, and which cannot be shared.

restricted.title: 🔐 Restricted references
restricted.description:
Properties propriatary to the owner of the CoreTIDE instance where the object was created,
but which may be shared with a defined list of approved counterparts.

reports.title: 📰 Intelligence Reports
reports.description: Registry of reports uploaded to this CoreTIDE instance

metadata.title: 🗃️ Metadata
metadata.description: Non technical indicators helping with overall data management

version.title: 🏷️ Version
version.description: Latest revision of the model object, always in integer

modified.title: 🗓️ Last Modification
modified.description: Creation date of the latest version

tlp.title: 🚦 Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol - or short: TLP - was designed with the objective to create a favorable classification scheme for sharing sensitive information while keeping the control over its distribution at the same time.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
### ⚪ clear

🔑 **Identifier** : `TLP:CLEAR`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Recipients can spread this to the world, there is no limit on disclosure.

### 🟢 green

🔑 **Identifier** : `TLP:GREEN`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Limited disclosure, recipients can spread this within their community. Sources may use TLP:GREEN when information is useful to increase awareness within their wider community.

### 🟠 amber

🔑 **Identifier** : `TLP:AMBER`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Limited disclosure, recipients can only spread this on a need-to-know basis within their organization and its clients.

### 🟠 amber+strict

🔑 **Identifier** : `TLP:AMBER+STRICT`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Similar to TLP:AMBER, but restricts sharing to the organization only.

### 🔴 red

🔑 **Identifier** : `TLP:RED`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

For the eyes and ears of individual recipients only, no further disclosure.

classification.title: 💡 Data Classification Marking
classification.description: Information Security classification for the data contained within the CoreTIDE object.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
### 💡 RESTREINT UE/EU RESTRICTED

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0001`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



💶 **European Union Classified Information** : _In order for the Council to be able to work in all areas which require the use of EU classified information (EUCI),
it needs to have a comprehensive security system to protect this information. The Council decision on the security
rules for protecting EU classified information lays down the basic pr..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

The unauthorised disclosure of this information could be disadvantageous to the interests of the EU or one or more of the member states.

### 💡 CONFIDENTIEL UE/EU CONFIDENTIAL

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0002`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



💶 **European Union Classified Information** : _In order for the Council to be able to work in all areas which require the use of EU classified information (EUCI),
it needs to have a comprehensive security system to protect this information. The Council decision on the security
rules for protecting EU classified information lays down the basic pr..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

The unauthorised disclosure of this information could cause exceptionally grave prejudice to the essential interests of the EU or one or more of the member states.

### 💡 SECRET UE/EU SECRET

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0003`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



💶 **European Union Classified Information** : _In order for the Council to be able to work in all areas which require the use of EU classified information (EUCI),
it needs to have a comprehensive security system to protect this information. The Council decision on the security
rules for protecting EU classified information lays down the basic pr..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

The unauthorised disclosure of this information could seriously harm the essential interests of the EU or one or more of the member states.

### 💡 TRÈS SECRET UE/EU TOP SECRET

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0004`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



💶 **European Union Classified Information** : _In order for the Council to be able to work in all areas which require the use of EU classified information (EUCI),
it needs to have a comprehensive security system to protect this information. The Council decision on the security
rules for protecting EU classified information lays down the basic pr..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

The unauthorised disclosure of this information could cause exceptionally grave prejudice to the essential interests of the EU or one or more of the member states.

### 💡 NATO Unclassified

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0006`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

This is applied to official information that is the property of NATO but 
does not meet the criteria for classification. Access to this information 
by non-NATO entities is permitted when such access would not be 
detrimental to NATO.


### 💡 NATO RESTRICTED

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0007`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would be 
disadvantageous to the interests of NATO. Though similar safeguards 
are applied to FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY, OFFICIAL USE ONLY, or 
SENSITIVE, BUT UNCLASSIFIED information, NATO RESTRICTED 
is a security classification.


### 💡 NATO CONFIDENTIAL

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0008`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would be 
damaging to NATO interests.


### 💡 NATO CONFIDENTIAL ATOMAL

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0009`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would be 
damaging to NATO interests.

This designation is added to the NATO security classification when 
applicable. For example, COSMIC TOP SECRET ATOMAL (CTS-A).
ATOMAL information applies to U.S. RESTRICTED DATA or 
FORMERLY RESTRICTED DATA or United Kingdom Atomic 
Information released to NATO. 


### 💡 NATO SECRET

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0010`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would cause 
serious damage to NATO.


### 💡 NATO SECRET ATOMAL

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0011`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would cause 
serious damage to NATO.

This designation is added to the NATO security classification when 
applicable. For example, COSMIC TOP SECRET ATOMAL (CTS-A).
ATOMAL information applies to U.S. RESTRICTED DATA or 
FORMERLY RESTRICTED DATA or United Kingdom Atomic 
Information released to NATO. 


### 💡 COSMIC TOP SECRET

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0012`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would cause 
exceptionally grave damage to NATO. COSMIC is applied to Top 
Secret material to signify it belongs to NATO. The term NATO TOP 
SECRET is not used.


### 💡 COSMIC TOP SECRET ATOMAL

🔑 **Identifier** : `DCM0013`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 



🪖 **NATO CLASSIFICATION MARKINGS** : _NATO information is information that has been generated by or for NATO, or member nation 
originated-information that has been released into the NATO security system. Information marked 
“NATO” is the property of NATO. NATO classified information contributed by a member nation 
remains the property ..._



[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Applied to information whose unauthorized disclosure would cause 
exceptionally grave damage to NATO. COSMIC is applied to Top 
Secret material to signify it belongs to NATO. The term NATO TOP 
SECRET is not used.

This designation is added to the NATO security classification when 
applicable. For example, COSMIC TOP SECRET ATOMAL (CTS-A).
ATOMAL information applies to U.S. RESTRICTED DATA or 
FORMERLY RESTRICTED DATA or United Kingdom Atomic 
Information released to NATO.

contributors.title: 👥 Research Contributors
contributors.description: Individuals who supported creating, enriching or informing the information contained in the document.

request.title: 🏛️ Description of the detection objective
request.description: Set of data detailing how and where to perform the detection, following an analysis and research process

domains.title: 🛰️ Domains
domains.description: Infrastructure technologies domain of interest to attackers.

markdownEnumDescriptions:
### ☁️ Public Cloud

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0001`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Infrastructure handled by a commercial cloud provider. Managed mostly on a service level, and connected over the internet.

### ☁️ Private Cloud

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0002`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Infrastructure hosted at a third party, but based on custom specification and managed on a platform level.

### 🏢 Enterprise

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0003`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Generic databases, applications, machines and systems that are usually on premises or on Cloud traditional VMs.

### 📱 Mobile

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0004`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Smartphones, tablets and applications running these devices.

### 🕸️ SaaS

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0005`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Subscription based access to software.

### 🌐 Networking

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0006`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Communications backbone connecting users, applications and machines.

### 🌏 OSINT

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0007`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Data publicly available to attackers used during reconnaissance.

### 🔧 Embedded

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0008`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Firmware, middleware and low level software running on devices which are typically not manageable by the consumer.

### 🦾 IoT

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0009`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Placeholder

### 🏭 Industrial

🔑 **Identifier** : `DOM0010`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Related to Industrial Control Systems, Operational Technologies their specific concepts (SCADA, PLCs, DCS etc.)

targets.title: 🎯 Targets
targets.description: Granular delimited technical entities holding a value to the organization, that are targeted by adversaries. They might be also involved in the detection coverage as the target of log collection. Partially inspired by Veris.

---

People - Manager

### 🖲️ Control Server

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0100`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Control_Server)

---

A device which acts as both a server and controller, that hosts the control software used in communicating with lower-level control devices in an ICS network (e.g. Remote Terminal Units (RTUs) and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs)).

### 🗄️ Data Historian

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0101`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Engineering_Workstation)

---

A centralized database located on a computer installed in the control system DMZ supporting external corporate user data access for archival and analysis using statistical process control and other techniques.

### 👷 Engineering Workstation

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0102`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Engineering_Workstation)

---

The engineering workstation is usually a high-end very reliable computing platform designed for configuration, maintenance and diagnostics of the control system applications and other control system equipment. The system is usually made up of redundant hard disk drives, high speed network interface, reliable CPUs, performance graphics hardware, and applications that provide configuration and monitoring tools to perform control system application development, compilation and distribution of system modifications.

### ⌨️ Field Controller/RTU/PLC/IED

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0103`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Field_Controller/RTU/PLC/IED)

---

Controller terminology depends on the type of system they are associated with. They provide typical processing capabilities. Controllers, sometimes referred to as Remote Terminal Units (RTU) and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), are computerized control units that are typically rack or panel mounted with modular processing and interface cards. The units are collocated with the process equipment and interface through input and output modules to the various sensors and controlled devices. Most utilize a programmable logic-based application that provides scanning and writing of data to and from the IO interface modules and communicates with the control system network via various communications methods, including serial and network communications.

### 🎰 Human-Machine Interface

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0104`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Human-Machine_Interface)

---

In computer science and human-computer interaction, the Human-Machine Interface (HMI) refers to the graphical, textual and auditory information the program presents to the user (operator) using computer monitors and audio subsystems, and the control sequences (such as keystrokes with the computer keyboard, movements of the computer mouse, and selections with the touchscreen) the user employs to control the program. Currently the following types of HMI are the most common: 

Graphical user interfaces(GUI) accept input via devices such as computer keyboard and mouse and provide articulated graphical output on the computer monitor. 
Web-based user interfaces accept input and provide output by generating web pages which are transported via the network and viewed by the user using a web browser program. The operations user must be able to control the system and assess the state of the system. Each control system vendor provides a unique look-and-feel to their basic HMI applications. An older, not gender-neutral version of the term is man-machine interface (MMI).
The system may expose several user interfaces to serve different kinds of users. User interface screens may be optimized to provide the appropriate information and control interface to operations users, engineering users and management users.

### 🖲️ Input/Output Server

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0105`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Input/Output_Server)

---

The Input/Output (I/O) server provides the interface between the control system LAN applications and the field equipment monitored and controlled by the control system applications. The I/O server, sometimes referred to as a Front-End Processor (FEP) or Data Acquisition Server (DAS), converts the control system application data into packets that are transmitted over various types of communications media to the end device locations. The I/O server also converts data received from the various end devices over different communications mediums into data formatted to communicate with the control system networked applications.

### 🦺 Safety Instrumented System/Protection Relay

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0106`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Safety_Instrumented_System/Protection_Relay)

---

A safety instrumented system (SIS) takes automated action to keep a plant in a safe state, or to put it into a safe state, when abnormal conditions are present. The SIS may implement a single function or multiple functions to protect against various process hazards in your plant.3 The function of protective relaying is to cause the prompt removal from service of an element of a power system when it suffers a short circuit or when it starts to operate in any abnormal manner that might cause damage or otherwise interfere with the effective operation of the rest of the system.

### 🧩 Function-as-a-Service

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0107`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://www.ibm.com/cloud/learn/faas)

---

FaaS (Function-as-a-Service) is a type of cloud-computing service that allows you to execute code in response to events without the complex infrastructure typically associated with building and launching microservices applications.

### 🗣️ Business Communication Tools

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0108`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Enterprise communication consists of an organization's tools and practices to collaborate and share information internally and externally. Common examples include phone, email, instant messaging, and face-to-face video meetings.

### 🧩 Windows API

🔑 **Identifier** : `TGT0109`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/apiindex/windows-api-list)

---

The Windows API, informally WinAPI, is Microsoft's core set of application programming interfaces (APIs) available in the Microsoft Windows operating systems. The name Windows API collectively refers to several different platform implementations that are often referred to by their own names (for example, Win32 API). Almost all Windows programs interact with the Windows API.

platforms.title: 💿 Platforms
platforms.description: Actual technologies used by the organization that will be exploited by adversaries during a successful attack, and eventually of relevance for detection. Are named by commercial designation.

### 💿 AWS EC2

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0031`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ec2/index.html)

---

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides resizable computing capacity—literally, servers in Amazon's data centers—that you use to build and host your software systems.

### 💿 AWS EKS

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0032`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/index.html)

---

Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) is a managed service that makes it easy for you to run Kubernetes on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes clusters.

### 💿 AWS ECS

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0033`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ecs/index.html)

---

Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) is a highly scalable, fast, container management service that makes it easy to run, stop, and manage Docker containers on a cluster of Amazon EC2 instances.

### 💿 AWS Fargate

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0034`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/userguide/what-is-fargate.html)

---

AWS Fargate is a technology that you can use with Amazon ECS to run containers without having to manage servers or clusters of Amazon EC2 instances.

### 💿 Azure AKS

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0035`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/)

---

AKS allows you to quickly deploy a production ready Kubernetes cluster in Azure. Learn how to use AKS with these quickstarts, tutorials, and samples.

### 💿 VMware Tanzu

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0036`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu/index.html)

---

Tanzu is a suite of products that helps users run and manage multiple Kubernetes (K8S) clusters across public and private clouds.

### 💿 OVHcloud

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0036`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/)

---

OVH, legally OVH Groupe SAS, is a French cloud computing company which offers VPS, dedicated servers and other web services.

### 💿 IBM Cloud Kubernetes

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0037`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-getting-started)

---

IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service is a managed offering to create your own Kubernetes cluster of compute hosts to deploy and manage containerized apps on IBM Cloud.

### 💿 Oracle Container Engine

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0038`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/ContEng/Concepts/contengoverview.htm)

---

Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Container Engine for Kubernetes is a fully-managed, scalable, and highly available service that you can use to deploy your containerized applications to the cloud.

### 💿 Microsoft SharePoint

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0039`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/)

---

Microsoft SharePoint is a cloud-based service that helps organizations share and manage content, knowledge, and applications

### 💿 Google Workspace

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0040`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://workspace.google.com/intl/en_id/)

---

Google Workspace is a collection of cloud computing, productivity and collaboration tools, software and products developed and marketed by Google.

### 💿 Outlook Web Access

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0041`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/troubleshoot/client-connectivity/set-up-web-access)

---

Outlook on the web (formerly known as Outlook Web App or Outlook Web Access) is a browser-based email client. Outlook on the web lets you access your Microsoft Exchange Server mailbox from almost any web browser.

### 💿 Microsoft Teams

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0042`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/)

---

Microsoft Teams is a proprietary business communication platform developed by Microsoft, as part of the Microsoft 365 family of products. Teams primarily competes with the similar service Slack, offering workspace chat and videoconferencing, file storage, and application integration.

### 💿 Slack

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0043`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://api.slack.com/docs)

---

Slack is a messaging program designed specifically for the office, but has also been adopted for personal use.

### 💿 Confluence

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0044`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/resources/)

---

Confluence is a web-based corporate wiki developed by Australian software company Atlassian. Atlassian wrote Confluence in the Java programming language and first published it in 2004. Confluence Standalone comes with a built-in Tomcat web server and hsql database, and also supports other databases.

### 💿 JIRA

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0045`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/resources/)

---

Jira is a proprietary issue tracking product developed by Atlassian that allows bug tracking and agile project management.

### 💿 Gitlab

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0046`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.gitlab.com/)

---

GitLab Inc. is an open-core company that provides GitLab, a DevOps software package that combines the ability to develop, secure, and operate software in a single application.

### 💿 Github

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0047`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.github.com/en)

---

GitHub, Inc. is a provider of Internet hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.

### 💿 Sysdig Backend

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0048`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://sysdig.com)

---

Sysdig, Inc. is a provider of runtime security solutions for everything based on *nix variants, including a focus on container environments. Available as Saas or IaaS.

### 💿 AWS VPC

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0049`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html)

---

A virtual private cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account. It is logically isolated from other virtual networks in the AWS Cloud. You can launch your AWS resources, such as Amazon EC2 instances, into your VPC.

### 💿 Bitbucket

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0050`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver)

---

Bitbucket is a Git-based source code repository hosting service owned by Atlassian.

### 💿 Bamboo

🔑 **Identifier** : `PFM0051`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki](https://support.atlassian.com/bamboo/)

---

Bamboo is a continuous integration and deployment tool that ties automated builds, tests and releases together in a single workflow

violation.title: 👮 Policy, mandate or governance violations
violation.description: Categories of usage violations which is not directly the result of an exercised threat, but needs to be monitored and accounted for illegitimate behaviours.
violation.example: Illegal or aberrant application found on host
enum: Illegal content streaming or usage of disallowed web service
Illegal or aberrant application found on host
Uncompliant remote access to internal resources
markdownEnumDescriptions:
### 👮 Illegal content streaming or usage of disallowed web service

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0001`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

This could be copyrighted material, but also includes other illegal categories

### 👮 Insecure communication protocol

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0002`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Usage of protocols that are outdated and unsecure. Examples of such protocols are FTP and telnet

### 👮 Vulnerable system or service

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0003`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Any vulnerable systems or applications / services that leave the system vulnerable for compromise

### 👮 Unauthorized process launched

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0004`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Launch of an unauthorized process. Examples of such processes are psexec, powershell and the command prompt. Also covers unauthorized processes running as a service

### 👮 Illegal or aberrant application found on host

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0005`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Any application present on hosts that are not allowed by policy or are quite simply illegal. Examples of such applications are hacking tools and pirated software

### 👮 Resource abuse

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0006`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

This use case is reserved for situations where systems are being abused, for example for bitcoin mining

### 👮 Unauthorized use of high-privileged account

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0007`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Any unauthorized use of accounts with high privileges, such as root accounts on Linux / UNIX and administrator accounts on Windows

### 👮 Unauthorized modification of technical policy

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0008`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Unauthorized modification of configuration settings. This can be a compliance issue, where the configuration may result in a hardening baseline deviation. It can also be part of malicious activity

### 👮 Uncompliant remote access to internal resources

🔑 **Identifier** : `VIO0009`

🔥 **Criticality** :  No Criticality Assigned 





[See in CoreTIDE Wiki]()

---

Legitimate remote activities not being achieved with organization approved means, such as using a third-party VPN or service, unsupported protocols or non-standard infrastructure.

justification.title: Reason of the request
justification.description: Explanation of why the request was dispatched
justification.example: Need to flag out of date web browser to reach updating policies

description.title: 🔬 Description of the request
description.description: Explanation of the request, and how it should be implemented in operations
description.example: Monitor for outdated user agents in web requests
